vehicle_project_description_short: Ein Visualisierungssystem zur Analyse der Ergebnisse einer Integration von Konflikt-Ereignisdaten.
tutorials_project_description_short: Spielerische Erklärungen zum Erlernen der Grundlagen der Erstellung interaktiver Datenvisualisierungen.
teaching_tasks_project_description_short: Übungsaufgaben zum Erlernen von D3.js anhand gesellschaftlich relevanter Datensätze.
characterization_project_description_sho: Ein Notebook zur Erklärung, welche Storytelling-Techniken in einer Sammlung von Datengeschichten verwendet wurden.
endovis_project_description_short: Eine interaktive Webanwendung zur Erforschung heterogener, zeitabhängiger chirurgischer Daten.
exex_project_description_short: Eine interaktive Datengeschichte zur Erklärung einer Methode der Kausalinferenz für Konfliktforscher:innen.
sec_about_work_paragraphs:
Ich arbeite freiberuflich und liebe es, interaktive Datenvisualisierungen zu erschaffen.

Während meiner Promotion habe ich mit Expert:innen aus der Konfliktforschung und Medizin zusammengearbeit. Dabei habe ich mich intensiv mit ihren fachlichen Herausforderungen auseinandergesetzt, um durch maßgeschneiderte Visualisierungslösungen echte Mehrwerte zu schaffen. Mein mathematischer Hintergrund hilft mir dabei, komplexe Probleme analytisch und strukturiert anzugehen.

Meine individuell entwickelten Lösungen reichen von
sec_about_work_bulletlist:
• Visualisierungssystemen zur Datenanalyse und Entscheidungsfindung bis zu
  • Visuellen Datengeschichten und interaktiven Notebooks um Erkenntnisse auf anschauliche und fesselnde Weise zu vermitteln.
sec_contact_question: Möchten Sie erfahren, wie Datenvisualisierung Ihnen helfen kann, Ihre fachlichen Herausforderungen zu lösen?
comment_sec_contact_invite: Ich freue mich auf Ihre Nachricht!
characterization_description_paragraph_1: DE To better understand how visual data stories are commonly written, we collected 130 online stories to analyze what kind of storytelling techniques they use.
characterization_description_paragraph_2: DE We focused on stories with a spatio-temporal context, as systematic analyses of them were still quite sparse. To classify the stories based on the storytelling techniques they use, we merged and adapted three existing design spaces. We analyzed the results of the classification by exploring overall distributions, comparing subsets, identifying trends, and using advanced techniques like multidimensional scaling.
characterization_description_paragraph_3: DE We summarized the results in an interactive notebook which facilitates an easy combination of visualizations and textual explanations, while providing the option to inspect the underlying code for full transparency.
endovis_description_paragraph_1: DE Integrated operating rooms provide rich and heterogeneous data about surgical procedures. This includes information about the different phases of a procedure, the instruments used, and the measurements of different devices. Such information is commonly time-dependent and complex to analyze in unison.
endovis_description_paragraph_2: DE To allow such comprehensive analysis, we created a visualization system to inspect and filter the information side-by-side. Together with medical experts, we discussed which views of the data are relevant for them and which interactions they require for analyzing the data more deeply. As they were not always aware of the different options that exist for doing so, we tried to get a deeper understanding of the goals they had for the data, based on which we provided them with a selection of suitable options to choose from.
endovis_description_paragraph_3: DE This prototyping-based iterative procedure led to a solution which allowed the experts to get a much more comprehensive understanding of the heterogeneous data.
exex_description_paragraph_1: DE EXEX better understand how visual data stories are commonly written, we collected 130 online stories to analyze what kind of storytelling techniques they use.
exex_description_paragraph_2: DE EXEX focused on stories with a spatio-temporal context, as systematic analyses of them were still quite sparse. To classify the stories based on the storytelling techniques they use, we merged and adapted three existing design spaces. We analyzed the results of the classification by exploring overall distributions, comparing subsets, identifying trends, and using advanced techniques like multidimensional scaling.
caption_characterization_deviations: DE For a subset of stories, bars depict how far the usage of the different storytelling techniques deviates from the average for that subset
caption_characterization_trends: DE The trends over the past five years regarding the average usage frequency of different storytelling techniques
caption_characterization_mds: DE The result of multidimensional scaling: Each circle represents one story, and the proximity of the circles represents how similar the corresponding stories are to each other
caption_characterization_sources: DE A comparison of the pairwise similarities between different story sources, like The New York Times (NYT)
caption_characterization_distribution: DE The distribution of the pairwise similarities between all stories
caption_endovis_procedures: DE A set of bar charts that can be re-arranged in synchrony
caption_endovis_align: DE A temporal alignment point can be changed across multiple views in parallel
caption_endovis_expand: DE Individual charts displaying device measurements over time can be enlarged for closer inspection
